intro: Stachys pycnostachya, commonly known as woolly betony, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
